intro: Tussilago bicolor, commonly known as the white and yellow cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its bi-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are fern-like and divided, while its flowers are small and clustered in umbels. Tussilago bicolor is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for respiratory ailments.
